note.p: Burial: Altar tomb in St Leonard's church, Exeter (now removed) (23 December 1721)
Education: Winchester College; New College, Oxford (matriculated 1675); BCL (1682), BMed (by decree 1685), DMed (1689); Leyden (admitted 1680)

Career: Practised in Oxford (1685); edited 'Philosophical Transactions' nos 167-178; practised in Exeter (1691- death); buried outside the city of Exeter, because he thought burial in the city was injurious to the health of the living
Editor Phil. Trans.: 1684-1686 (along with Francis Aston)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Foster; Gunther
Notes: DNB refers to Collinson who said that Musgrave was born at Charlton Musgrove in 1657. Index to BR gives burial date as death date
